Package uno.anahata.asi.model.core

Class AbstractPart

java.lang.Object
uno.anahata.asi.model.core.AbstractPart
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractToolCall, AbstractToolResponse, BlobPart, TextPart
public abstract class AbstractPart extends Object implements PropertyChangeSource
The abstract base class for all components of a AbstractMessage. This class is central to the V2 context management system, providing a rich, self-contained model for intelligent, time-based pruning and full context awareness.
Author:
anahata-gemini-pro-2.5

      Sets the pruned state of this part and fires a property change event.
      Parameters:

    • remove

      public void remove()
      Removes this part from its parent message and severs the bidirectional link.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the part is not attached to a message.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

    • removePropertyChangeListener

      public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)

      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.

    • isEffectivelyPruned

      public boolean isEffectivelyPruned()
      Calculates the EFFECTIVE pruned state of this part, now with "deep pinning" logic. A part is effectively pruned if it was explicitly pruned, if its PARENT MESSAGE was explicitly pruned, or if its time-to-live has expired. Crucially, it is considered NOT pruned if it or its parent message is "pinned" (pruned=false).
      Returns:
      true if the part is effectively pruned, false otherwise.

    • getTurnsLeft

      public int getTurnsLeft()
      Calculates the remaining turns before this part is auto-pruned.
      Returns:
      The number of turns left, or a large positive number for indefinite retention.

    • getEffectiveTurnsToKeep

      public final int getEffectiveTurnsToKeep()
      The definitive method for resolving the retention policy for this part. It follows the Template Method pattern, first checking for an explicit instance-level override before falling back to the subclass-specific default.
      Returns:
      The effective number of turns to keep this part.

    • getDefaultTurnsToKeep

      protected abstract int getDefaultTurnsToKeep()
      Template method hook for subclasses to provide their specific default retention policy. This is the fallback value used when no explicit turnsToKeep is set on the instance.
      Returns:
      The default number of turns for this part type.

    • getChat

      public Chat getChat()
      Gets the parent chat session.
      Returns:
      The chat session, or null if not attached to a message.

    • getChatConfig

      public ChatConfig getChatConfig()
      Gets the chat configuration.
      Returns:
      The chat configuration, or null if not attached to a chat.

    • asText

      public abstract String asText()
      Returns the content of the part as a simple string. This is implemented by subclasses.
      Returns:
      The text representation of the part.

    • getPropertyChangeSupport

      public PropertyChangeSupport getPropertyChangeSupport()
      Gets the PropertyChangeSupport instance for this object.

      Returns:
